Title: Great for women with decent picture quality
Comments: If you're looking to gift your mom or girlfriend, this camera will not break the bank and keep them happy!

Title: Pink Point and Shoot
Pros: My girlfriend loves it so far. Works on her mac powerbook. I got it for her birthday and I got lots of kisses for it.

Title: Solid
Cons: No optical viewfinder (typical of subcompacts like this)
Pros: Sturdy, multi-point autofocus, anti-shake, several menu languages, several preset configurations for almost any situation, nice LCD (size and quality.) Unbeatable price-point.
Comments: I'm no expert in photography, for me anything above 3MP already lets me print my pictures in the 6x4 format. This camera is very simple to use, with a very well designed menu system. The picture and movie qualities seemed excellent to me. The camera is solidly built, and surprisingly fast. Other than a greater zoom, I don't see anything missing from this camera at the point-and-shoot level.

Title: Classic and Colorful!
Pros: This camera has both optical and digital zoom, making the print quality of pictures incredible. The various file sizes are all print quality and this camera will permit you to set your own f-stop and other various settings. It even has an 'easy' mode if you want everything to be automatic!
Comments: I wish I had purchased this camera sooner... the money I spent on another seems wasted now that I know the incredible quality available in a Casio!
